On tap from Ryan's in St. Julians. Aroma is citrus, pine, and initial taste is fruity followed immediately with a bold bitterness which resonates. Very well balanced and excellent tasting. One of my favourite IPAs ever.

Appearance: clear golden colour with white small head. Crystal.
Aroma: grass, hops, fruits. Good.
Taste: light body, good bitterness. Too watery.
klasyczna ipa z chmielowa, niezalegajaca goryczka, wytrawna i pijalna z tropikalnymi owocami w smaku i aromacie.

This IPA has a stunningly beautiful foaming. Aroma is citrus and spices. The taste is dominated by grapes, pine needles and spices like grass, coriander and basil. It's an extremely delicate IPA, where the hop bitterness is significant, but is not bitter than a level where I think everyone will be able to find positive things
Bardzo klasyczne IPA, dobra, intensywna, ale nie lodygowa i nie zalegająca goryczka, wytrawne, dobre.

12oz bottle. Pretty awesome that an IPA brewed in 1997 can still hold up in 2017. The hop bill is a little NW antiquated, but bitter and bold at the same time, more so than most IPAs these days. Filtered, which keeps it clean, because the hops and overall mouthfeel are pretty solid and intense. Pretty much a great IPA that has stood the test of time.

330ml can. Pours slightly hazy amber, foamy white head, sticky lacing. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, bit resinous, malty and very well balanced. Very nice nose! Taste is bitter, juicy, tropical, resinous, lots of grapefruit, orange peel. Some herbal and grassy notes in aftertaste. Taste is bit more harsh than aroma, but still lovely. Medium + bodied, bit over average carbo. Really good example of pure breed IPA.
This is one of my go to IPA's. It is nice and hoppy without being too high in ABV. Very drinkable.
On tap at Vista Village Pub. Hazy Golden with medium head! Malty and hoppy aroma ned taste!

Aroma is huge mango, orange and some pine. Looks awesome in the glass - dark gold huge white head. Taste is similar to the aroma but a little bitter with some malt and grassiness. Overall a solid ipa but kinda expected a little more given the hype.
Blik gedeeld door Benzai. Goudgeel bier. Ietsje troebel. Aroma is hoppig en hooiachtig. Smaak is zoet, fruitig en hoppig. Weinig nasmaak.
Blik gedeeld door Benzai, geprobeerd met Inoven. Het is een troebel geel bier met een dunne witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een fruitige grassige geur. De smaak is hoppig en citrus achtig.
Złoty kolor, bardzo obfita czapa białej piany. W aromacie cytrusy i żywica. W smaku mocno chmielowo, dominują cytrusy i żywica, piwo dosyć wytrawne.

From Aug 2007

Bought as part of a mixed 6Pack at Wilbur's Liquors in Ft Collins.

It pours from 12oz bottle a clear gold with a large head of foam that shrinks to a fine broken layer with lacing.

The smell is an abundance of citrus hops and spice. When I take deep wiffs, I can also smell some sweet malt. It's a very good nose.

The taste is, well. yummy. Plenty of citrus(grapefruit) there, which is typical for a Stone brew but probably never boring, and about midway through, there's a more than ample maltiness that balances out this IPA beautifully. Man, this baby is packed with flavour and is so easy to drink....a world class American IPA if I ever tasted one. And that's with it coming straight out of the fridge. The flavours get even better as the beer warms up. The mouthfeel is great and it finishes with just the right amount of bitterness to leave me yearning for more. Superb!

Well, I've had this IPA many times before and I always "assumed" that I had already reviewed it. My bad.

Can form Berlin Stone, canned on 18.05.2017 
Appearance: nice white head, golden and a bit hazy 
Aroma: tropical fruits, mainly passion fruit and mango. 
Taste: high bitterness and not very strong notes of hops - tropical fruits and low fruit like sweetness, but the beer is rather dry. 
Very decent IPA

Forventninger var nok lidt for store. Efter at have smagt to enkle og gode session ipa inden, virkede denne lidt sød og bitterheden ikke i balance. Den føltes mere som en American Pale Ale. God, men jeg var ikke væltet om kuld.

Aroma deutliche Hopfennote mit tropischen Früchten und grasigen Noten. Antrunk erst fruchtig, leicht bitter. Dann deutlicher Hopfen mit Bitternoten, grasig floraler Noten und einer spürbaren Alkoholnote. Im Abgang trocken und bitter.

Canette achetée chez Amstein - De couleur dorée translucide ave. une belle mousse blanche qui colle bien au verre - Au nez on part directement sur de la resine, des fruits, agrumes et fruits tropicaux, une bonne présence de malt, et une touche herbacée - En bouche on reste sur la même chose pas mal de résine, herbacé et malt les fruits se mettent plus en retrait - Corp moyen, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, soyeuse, final amère herbacé long - Typique american ipa, sans extravagance

Citrus, pine, resin, malt giving the idea of honey. Pours golden-amber with large head. In taste dry, intensely hoppy: citrusy, resiny, a bit of tropical fruit, with moderate grapefruity bitterness and crisp malty background. Medium body and carbonation, despite relatively high bitterness it's very drinkable. Tasty, looks like the reputation is well-earned.
Owoce tropikalne, cytrusy, słodowość. Średnie ciało, półwytrawne. Średnie wysycenie, średnia do wysokiej goryczka, na szczęście dość krótka i niezalegająca.

Bottled. Amber colour with a slight haze and a very small, off-white head. Honey, yellow fruit, and a faint hint of pine. Very dry throughout. Very hoppy with pine-resin bitterness that's very strong on the finish. Clean with a good balance of bitterness, acidity, and alcohol.

Can from Marks and Spencer. Drunk at home. Light gold, a bit hazy with a large but quickly dissipating white head. Lots of lacing left. Pine needles, mango lassi, ample resin and lemon balm in the sumptuous aroma. Initially sweet taste turns bitter quickly, although it tempers with repeated sips. Long finish with key lime and lots more pine in the aftertaste. Pretty good stuff.

330ml can. Pours a large head, liquid a cloudy amber colour. Aroma is strong citrus and taste is slightly sweet with a good bitterness and is well balanced. Good, long finish with a lingering bitterness.

Tolle Perligkeit, frisch aus der grünen Dose. Ordentlicher Schaum, da bricht nix weg. In der Nase cremig feine Mango. Ebenso im Trunk, mittig kommt etwas der Alkohol, dann holzig, bitter, süffig. Geiles Ding.
Dobra IPA w stylu West coast. Niezła piana drobnopecherzykowa. W smaku dużo chmielu, żywicy. Klasyk stylu.
Ipa de poco cuerpo, ligera,muy gasificada,con sabores herbales,pino...cerveza comercial.

Has a light aroma of citrus, floral and fresh brewed tea. Very hop forward blend, hard to pick out individual flavors on this one but its a nice balance and mix of citrus, pine and dark fruit, none stand out more than the other. Finishes off with a long dry, bitter finish that lingers for quite a while. Very tasty and one I've been wanting to try for a while now, glad I did.

33cl can brewed in Berlin. Great fresh fruity nose. Lots of floral hops. The beer starts fresh and fruity. Intense and mild in one. Sticky with herbal parts, great depth with lots of hops. Long fruity bitter herbal aftertaste. Great.

Puszka do 27.01.2018
Aromat: żywiczny, w tle trochę cytrusów. Trochę jak leśna kostka toaletowa. Nic specjalnego.
Wygląd: obfita, średniopęchrzykowa piana, dość szybko znika. Barwa złocista. Klarowne.
Smak: Jak w aromacie - głównie żywica, trochę cytrusów. Goryczka średnia do średnio wysokiej, lekko skontrowana słodyczą. Trochę zalegająca.
Ogólnie: Poprawne, ale nic specjalnego.

Tap at Mel's Craft Beer & Diner, Vienna. Pours clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of sweet fruit, malt, hop and caramel. Moderate sweetness, medium plus bitterness.. Medium body, slight oily texture, average to soft carbonation

12floz bottle, stamped BOD: 07.17.2017 and BBD: 10.30.2017, $1.75 unit cost, tulip glass. Appears a glowing golden yellow color with foam, blah, blah, blah...Smells like cut up citrus fruit sprinkled with garden herbs. The palate is hop centric, thin on the malts. Plant stems and green leaf flavors linger on the palate. At one time, I thought this beer was well composed. Now it it just seems like a run of the mill moderately bitter AIPA and nothing else. This is to say it is okay, but I used to remember a touch more juicy sweetness as a counterbalance. As is in this review, it lacks a malt backbone. Not that great, I suspect the high rating here is  based largely on legacy and before the flood of one-dimensional IPAs. Unfortunately, Stone Pale Ale has somehow become scarce in my area,. I'd like seek it out to see it if has held up to past memory (for better or worse). Stone brewery has really lost it's luster in the last ten years. They are no longer a highly regarded beer maker in my book. Just one of the crowd.
About as good  and reliable as beer gets. West Coast style, fruity and piney. Love it.

0.33L can. Cloudy amber color with huge white hat, stays few minutes. Egg white, rotten orange nose. Disturbing alcohol taste is coming first, single hop, and strong grapfruit seed taste. Pleasant, messi, strong bitter finish. Grapfruit mouthfeel stays some time.

330ml can from Kaufland Merzig, Saarland, Germany!


Pours clear golden with a high white head. Aroma has lots of hops, grapefruit, orange peel and pine. Taste has tons of grapefruit, orange, exotic fruits, pine and spruce. Finish is dry bitter, fruity, again massive grapefruity!

From can (brewed Jan.'17) in IPA glass. Lively pour: cloudy amber with big head that muted hop aroma. Beautiful, tasty malt base with piney hop bitterness coming through in the finish. Had this many years ago in LAX and will need to revisit closer to the source to taste at its prime.

Honestly, after listening to folks hype Stone IPA for such a long period of time, I was expecting fireworks and a marching band. No doubt -- it is a very good IPA -- but, it did not knock my socks off. Poured with a medium head; clear and golden to maybe copper in appearance; hoppy aroma; both citrus, some pine, and just a little malt in the taste. The finish was a little too crisp for me.
My current go to IPA in a can. Excellent IPA colour and taste. Cannot fault this.
Cytrusy, grejpfrut, mango. Niestety zapach dość ubogi. Mocna goryczka jak na west coasta przystało.
very bitter, fantastic colour and an easily drinkable IPA, for it's strength. this one will creep up on you! a staple of the IPA world and now (thankfully) quite common in UK supermarkets canned.

appearance: slightly hazy golden colour. Good fluffy head. aroma: big fresh nose, citrus, pine, grapefruit. Palate: smooth medium full, medium carbonation.  taste: full of hop flavours to match nose. Decent bitterness with grassy aftertaste,

Can from local Tesco. Huge, white head, golden colour, clear. Aroma: hops, lots of hops, grapefruit peel, spruce, pine, lemon. Very bitter taste, bitter finish, lively, full body. Proper IPA, nicely bitter, but flat palate, lacks of something.

F: huge, light tan, good retention.
C: deep gold, light hazy.
A: tangerine, orange, bit tropical fruits, biscuits, honey, strawberry.
T: malty backbone, grapefruits, tangerine, tropical fruits, bit herbal, pine resin, long lasting bitterness, medium to full body, medium carbonation, very good, enjoyed, 33cl can as “Stone (Berlin) IPA” from Bierwinkel De Hopduvel in Gent.

Aroma: pleasant nose of citrus, herbs and pine. 
Moderately intensive taste of herbs mix, citrus and flowers. Some notes of honey and pine. Interesting mix

Bottle. Pours clear golden with huge white head. Aroma is spruce, resin, grapefruit and passion fruit. Taste is medium sweet and medium to very bitter. Body is oily with medium carbonation. Finish is long and intense fruity with notes that follow the nose plus notes of yoghurt and strawberry. Nicely balanced.

330 ml can. Pours with a clear, Golden Color and a nice white head. Fruity nose of grapefruit peel, hoppy with some piney Notes. Taste is not as hoppy as I remember. Nice fruity flavors with a resinous and bitter dry finish.

Can 33 cl. Pours a clear golden to copper with a medium white head and an aroma of mainly hops, citrus and pine, mango and sweet malts. The taste medium sweet with an intense long lasting hoppy finish. Very good IPA!

Goudblond bier met stevige witte schuimkraag. Geur: veel hop, exotisch fruit, citrus en wat dennen. Smaak: strak en scherp hopbitter, citrus en hars, maar in balans met wat zoetigheid. Afdronk: bitter, droog. Een mooie hopbeet, lekker!

Lata from Stone Berlin. Unclear like nice deep golden colour, big white head, well lasting, good lacing. Pleasant aroma of fruity hops, a pleasant sweetness, pine,wet dry grass and some alcohol. Flavour is sweet fruity piney hoppy peachy with a good well lasting and well present bitterness indeed, not ripping though. Nice but not really up by them 4.0.....

12oz bottle. Pours gold with a moderate white head. Aroma is caramel, grapefruit, pine, and floral hops. Taste is similar; strong hops balanced out by malt. A good amount of resin. Bitter. Dry. Not-quite-medium body. Medium carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel.

Berlin-brewed version, on tap at Stone Berlin about a year ago. From notes. Very fruity but with a faint bit of onion-garlic roughness in the nose. Firmly bitter with that familiar sticky resin. Juicy and as balanced as this beer ever gets, which is not quite.
Aroma is hoppy citrus, grainy, grapefruit, some malts. Good solid body, smooth medium bitter finish. Very comfortable drinking IPA.

Aroma humle, sitrus, aprikos, krydder, malt, humle. Utseende uklar gylden med hvitt skum som daler fort. Smak sitrus, aprikos, karamell, krydder, humle, malt. Boks på The Bishops Arms 33cl 6,9% BF 021017
Bottle from Beers of the World. Lots of citrusy hops balanced with some malt.
Clear pale coloured IPA. Very hoppy and fruity, a good beer but nothing special!
Can. Clear dark amber pour with white head. Aroma has sweet lime. Taste is balanced with a bitter kick. Malty backbone. Heavy body. Medium carbonation. Old school. Not bad
Medium body, Clean aftertaste, Good balance, Grain incense, Not strong aroma
Golden, slightly amber. Clear. Hoppy, fruity aroma at the medium level for a west coast ipa (as for style). Very well balanced taste, fruity and bitter. Excellent IPA!

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Can 33 cl - Batch 170407DE0102 (JAN.2018). AROMA: predominant oxidized hops (cheese) with low malt background (slightly sweet). APPEARANCE: dark gold and clear. m?dium ivory head with good retention. TASTE: m?dium-low oxidized hops (dried grass), followed by almost neutral and slightly sweet malt background. high bitterness with a bitter and almost harsh finish. PALATE: m?dium-low body with m?dium carbonation. slight astringency. OVERALL: unfortunately another oxidized IPA from the Berlin Stone operation.

Canned 330ml. -Berlin version. Clear pale golden coloured, medium sized white head, mild hoppy nose. Sweet malty, grapefruity hoppy, notes of caramel and alcohol with moderate bitterness in the finish. Quite nice.

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 7-17-17. "RVA 05/22/17. EJBY 09/04/17." Strong, heavily herbal, ?dank,? mineral aroma. Scent of grapefruit. Pours a highly effervescent bronze with a moderate amount of beige head. Produces good lacing. Excellent, dry, highly likable flavor. Pine and a touch of sweet peach (but definitely not too sweet). Good underlying malt flavor comes to the fore as initial hops shock dissipates. Nice, bitter finish and aftertaste. Medium to full body. Lively in the palate. Highly drinkable and likable. A superb, aromatic, and delicious classic. What brewers should strive for their IPAs to be. Quintessential. 8.4.8.4.17=>4.1

Bottle from Vons, Las Vegas. Pours clear golden with a diminishing, small, white head. The aroma contains hops, spices, fruits (grapefruit), some citrus and yeast. It tastes medium to heavy bitter and light sweet, with a rather astringent, dry finish. Medium body, oily/slick texture, fizzy carbonation. Not very satisfying to me.

Bursztynowa nieprzejrzysta farba. W zapachu slodowe z nutami gruszek, zóltych jablek. W smaku srednio pelne, lekko cytrusowa goryczka niezbyt dlugo pozostajaca na podniebieniu. Bardzo ladnie utrzymujacy sie lacing. Piwo srednio wysycone.

Can. Honey gold, off white heavily laced head. Aromas of grapefruit, passionfruit, pepper, pine needles and a big caramel backing. Big, bitter front palate full of dominating grapefruit and some pine cones. Balancing caramel malt middle that is understated but does it's job perfectly. Long, dry finish with a lick of pine. Undetectable alcohol, never cloying and drinkable. Magnificent beer and a West Coast IPA to judge all others.
Oranjekleurig, licht troebel. Volle witte schuimkraag. Mango, perzik, abrikoos, steenfruit, gist. Hoppig, mild bittere afdronk. Redelijk vol, beetje creamy mondgevoel. Zéér goeie ipa.

Thick white head, golden in color with the trademark haze of a good IPA. It smells of herbs and earthy notes. Quite pleasant really. Butt that doesn’t really translate into flavor. The hops are subtle but allow the flavors of the malts shine through. It’s not really bitter at all and there are some after tastes that make me wish for citrus hops but c’est la vie.

330 ml can (Berlin) @home,canned 24/04/2017,bb 19/01/2018.
Orange,slightly hazy,quickly diminishing head.
Aroma of citrus and hoppy bitterness.
Taste is bitter,not overpowering with some citrus in background.
Can from ASDA. Clear, golden with a good white head. Malt, citrus and pine aroma, pine dominates the flavour with a little citrus I’m there too. Dry finish

Aroma: Grapefruit and hay.
Appearance: Dark gold color with lightly hazy liquid and frothy white head.
Taste: Medium bitterness and medium sourness.
Palate: Medium body with thin texture and soft carbonation. Sour and bitter grapefruit finish.
Overall: Very sour and bitter feeling. Goes great with appetizers or even by itself.

Can from Westhill Service Station. It’s a clear fiery gold with a decent fluffy white head. Some nice bubbles trails in the glass look refreshing. Taking a sniff and you can smell that bittering pine straight off the bat. There sharp citrus, like lime and grapefruit and a sweetening hint of candy floss. I take a sip expecting full on pine but am surprised when I get lovely caramel notes kicking things off. You don’t have to wait long though before that pine and grapefruit take centre stage. There’s a very gentle warm spice taking the edge from the sting. The beer feels soft, slightly oily with a great sharp, dry sparkle to help lighten the hop load. I was almost hesitant about Stone IPA such is its reputation expecting an overpowering resinous hop overload. Yes the hops slowly dominate the profile but it’s much more balanced than I expected and very drinkable as a result. It’s hefty, there’s no getting round that, but it is a very fine example of the West Coast style IPA.

Clear, amber.

Grapefruit, gooseberry, malt.
Balanced malty sweetness and moderate hoppy bitterness.
Long bitter finish.

Good.

33 cL Can at home. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is a bit sweet with caramel, pine, some fruity hops, citrus and hops. Taste is slightly sweet with malts, pine, some tropical fruits, biscuit and an over medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.

Puszka, 330 ml. W nosie trochę słodkich, przejrzałych owoców, marakuja, grejpfrut, może pomelo, delikatna podbudowa słodowa wpadająca w jasne pieczywo. W smaku odpowiednio wytrawne, jak na west coast przystało, mimo że zasyp dość obfity (obstawiam 16-stkę), słód lekko odczuwalny, ale w tle, zdecydowanie chmiel z przodu.
0,33 l Dose. Oranges, trübes Bier, cremeweißer, stabiler Schaum, schöne Gardine. Riecht nach Ananas und Karamell. Schmeckt süßlich, fruchtig, angenehm bitter.
From 330ml can. Pours amber with some head. Quite a hoppy IPA with bitterness about it. Not bad, but nothing to get tremendously excited about

(12oz bottle - part of a mixed Pale Ale 12-pack)
AROMA: very nice hop nose, grapefruit, green, fresh, good maltiness, lovely nose 
APPEARANCE: medium Amber, robust Looking, full head that lingers. 
TASTE: yummy, bold hops on front and back, smokey grain, tobacco, toast, some citrus peal ... very layered
PALATE: medium to medium heavy body, well balanced, some crispness, bitter dry followthru. 
OVERALL: a very good IPA, enjoyable, robust, I liked the perfect balance between roasted maltiness and hops. I would almost consider this a craft IPA ... a standard for judging IPAs.
Golden coloured beer with an huge frothy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and a some floral notes. Flavor is citrus, biting pine and lots of grape fruit.. Medium to heavy palate. Smooth finish.
Can. Clear amber color with tiny white head. Aroma - Citrus, flowers, malt, hops, biscuit. Taste - Bitter, grapefruit, light pine, mango, tangerine.

.33 can. Clear pale gold,thick,stable,ugly head,a lot of lacing. Aroma grassy,citrusy,lemon,flowers. Taste thick,smooth,sweetish but but generally rarer dry. Carbonation medium to low. Bitterness medium,short,very nice. Aftertaste grassy,lemon,citrusy,intense watermelon. Really nice.
330ml can from Dekabrist in Engels. Brewed in Germany. Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, pale malts. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, orange, heavy bitterness.

Can. Pours clear golden with thick stable white head. Aroma is fruity, resiny, lot of pine and touch of herbs. Moderate bitter, resin and herbs on tongue. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture, long bitter finish.
Can. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Dose 0,33l: Golden, leichte Trübung, sehr kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; sehr fruchtige und frische Nase, Zitrusaromen, helle Früchte, Maracuja, Grapefruit, Malz, kräftige frische Hopfenaromen; frischer Körper, kräftige Hopfenaromen, Malz, Getreide, kräftige fruchtige Bitterkeit, dunkle/getrocknete Früchte, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, recht trocken, würzig, leichte Röstaromen; angenehmer würzig-trockener Nachgang mit kräftiger Hopfennoten

This is the first IPA I believe I've ever tasted and it hasnt changed since in the god knows how many years since the first time. It's just delicious plain and simple, the standard I set for all IPAs I drink 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. 6.9%. Best before 31.12.17. Brewed in Berlin. Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow/golden, with a diminishing off-white head. Spotty lacing. Somewhat unbalanced aroma; hops, a bit cheesy; fruit, both overripe and regular; and slightly citrusy. Has a sort of cooked vegetables note to it as well. Flavour is fruity, citrusy. Light cheesy hops note. Spicy and cough drop hints as it warms. Bitter finish, lingering, along with a hop note, a mild alcohol burn and fledgling hints of rubber. Overall so-so; not bad, but the aroma does leave something to be desired, while the flavour is okay, if nothing special. 20.06.17.

Dose bei Rewe in der Ackerstrasse gekauft, gebraut in Berlin.
Blasses aber klares Bernstein, voller und großporiger Schaum
Aroma: sehr schönes Mango, Aprikose, Hopfen, Grapefruit, Zitrone
Geschmack: bitter, Heu, etwas Grapefruit, blumig
Eher saftartig, wenig Kohlensäure

Complex nose, piney, resiny with some bready notes. Rich bitter flavor, backed up by a malty sweetness. Slick, slightly oily body. Finish bitter, slightly harsh, but by no means overbittered. Excellent IPA

33 cl. can @ Home. Brewed in Berlin.
Aroma: not very intense aromas of grapefruit, grapes, passion fruit, citrus, tropical fruits. Subtle hints of pine, resin. Some malt background appeared as the beer was warming.
Appearance: light amber to golden color, light hazyness, high head thickness. Super creamy slightly off-white head made of mid sized to big sized bubbles. High retention. Very low Brussels’ lacing, almost non-existent.
Taste: low sweetness, medium to high bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of grapefruit, citrus, passion fruit. Tastes slightly sweet at first, but increasingly bitter towards the end.
Palate: light to medium body, oily texture, low to medium carbonation, very long and very dry bitter finish of grapefruit, resin, pine, citrus, tropical fruits, passion fruit.
Overall: very good appearance. Not very intense but good aromas and flavors of grapefruit, resin, pine, citrus. Quite refreshing and thirst quenching. Good IPA but not as good as i’d heard, maybe this one brewed in Berlin is not as good as the American one.

Can at home from Fakta. Clear yellow with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel), medium+ hoppy (piney, citrusy). Flavor medium sweet, medium+ bitter, spicy, long lasting bitterness. Medium body.

330 ml can from Marks & Spencers, brewed in Berlin, Germany. Aromas of tropical fruits, malts, subtle pine. Big white head and more or less clear golden body. Taste is sharp malts with hoppy bitterness. Floral, fruity notes and citrus finish. Very nice beer.
Amber. Powerful spicy hop aroma and flavour, and light caramel sweetness. Very bitter finish. Medium body, and a smooth mouthfeel Overall, a great IPA. Very tasty.

Rocky white head left a cover on an unclear, finely carbonated straw coloured body.
Citrus, hops, pine & pineapple.aroma.
Medium bodied, tingly on the palate with an light feel followed by a soft clean back.
Bitter pithy tastes of grapefruit, zest, pine, caramel & orange.
330ml can @ 6.9 % . Pine aromas, grapefruits and floral, taste is similar. Didn’t massively enjoy this one, remember the bottle tasting much nicer. Possibly a bad batch.
33cl can. Light amber colour with average whitehead. aroma of hops lemons, oranges and grapefruit. well-balanced and full bodied, exemplary IPA

Nos super, świeże chmiele, owoce egzotyczne, ale za to trochę masła żeby nie było tak różowo. Dość ciekawe, ale kurde z drugiej strony trochę pustki... To nie zasługuje na takie oceny. Mogliby dosypać nieco więcej na goryczkę....

W aromacie chmiel z paczki, ale nie takie najlepszy. Barwa zlota, piana ladna, utrzymujaca sie. W smaku pelne owocowe. Goryczka intensywna, cytrusowa, zalegajaca. Wytrawne, fajne. Brakuje aromatu, ale to chyba kwestia swiezosci.

Golden amber pour with minimal head. Strong aromas of fresh pine, citrus fruits lemon, grapefruit and earthy herbs. Taste is clean; pale malt body dominated by big hop flavors; bold but balanced bitterness. Slick mouthfeel medium body, with moderate carbonation. Very good west coast IPA.

Good floral smell, just like an ipa should smell. 
Big white foam the disappear quickly, dark yellow color. 
Taste ok, but a little thin
Classic IPA. Full bodied, full of citrus, lemons, oranges and grapefruit. Plenty of piney hops. One to compare others to. A good IPA benchmark
Can. Pours pale amber with a perfect white foam residing. Scent is medium notes of middle hopped sweetness. Taste is consistent with notes of citrus. Some properties of dark fruit. Lovely.

Can (Berlin) and draft (US). Golden orange with an off-white head. Aroma has lots of hops, sweet caramelt malt, hay. Moderate sweet with hops, caramel, hay, pine. Grapefruit bitter aftertaste that is moderate bitter. I think I prefer the draft version.
Puszka z Berlina. Niegdyś rewelacja, dziś mocno przykurzony klasyk. Klarowne, poważnie goryczkowe, co się niefajnie odkłada w posmaku.
Wow. Ny farvoritøl. Fantastisk god smag. Dejlig med humle. Super frisk smag. Købt på tilbud i Fakta

Extremely good IPA. This is another benchmark for IPA’s. The amount of citrus flavor packed into this IPA is incredible and the hop finish leaves enough like an IPA to be thoroughly enjoyable. This is going to be a go-to IPA.
Pours clear golden witth a one finger high white head. Aroma; Citrus, pine, tropical fruits and floral. Taste; Hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, mango, tangarine and pine.

Classic for being what it is: a solid IPA that has all the earmarks and no detractors: big citrus and pine aroma from a beautiful pour; full body with chunks of pine bark resin swimming around your tongue; and a bitter and sweet taste that eventually allows the hops to win out to a dry, but not too dry, finish. Excellent.

Can, 33cL. Gift from the staff of La Cervoiserie, Les Herbiers. Thank you !! Home. A golden orange-yellow beer with a small white head ; average retention. Fruits (red berries, tropical fruits, citrus), resin, light herb. Medium bitter refreshing, very dry, light sweet, light warming background, light spicy. Medium body, light to medium oily texture, average carbonation, dry fruity spicy refreshing finish. Overall, delicious !

Delicious world class IPA.
Beautiful clear honey colored with a medium frothy head.
Fruity hops flavor smooth and good

Aroma: sewage, onion, maybe a bit pine notes. Meh.
Taste: bitter, little pine and some unpleasant (sewage?) notes. Bitterness in aftertaste.
Head is just OK.
Overall: bad beer imo. Yuck.
amber, clear, white foam, citrus, herbs, floral, resin, medium body, thick feel, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,
Can. A sharp taste of hops but it quickly fades. Aroma is a little faint. An ok IPA but I have had better.

Pours clear amber with a good head. Pine, malt and citrus on the nose. Lots of hop character with biscuit and citrus flavours. Finishes long and bitter. A classic.

This is an excellent IPA it's not too hoppy and doesn't leave an harsh aftertaste.

LCI. Uit blik geschonken. Mooie IPA, lekker bitter, hoppig, fruitig en een prettige bitter-grassige nasmaak. Prima!
Clear golden appeareance with a decent white head. Pine, malt, citrus, grass and grape aroma. Taste og pine, grapefruit, hoppy freshness and citrus.

Pours clear amber with a good head. 
Pine, malt and citrus on the nose. 
Lots of hop character with biscuit and citrus flavours. 
Finishes long and bitter. 
A classic.

Can, brewed in Berlin, Germany. Pours clodu yellow with average white head. Aroma is lemon, lemongrass, malt, a hint of pine and candy malt. Taste is bitter with pine, lemon, candy malt. Very well balanced.
From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours crisp golden with white foam. Aroma is resinous and piney. Body is medium-dense. Taste is bitter. Finish is long and bitter.
Puszka 330ml. Zloty kolor. Piana biala ,srednia o duzych pecherzach. W zapachu cytrusy i szyszki. W smaku dosc cierpkie o cytrusowym zacieciu, dojrzale owoce w tle z chmielowym akcentem. Urodzinowo
Can from Tesco Extra, Longton. Pours golden. Good chewy slightly resinous well hopped ipa. A bargain too!

Pivo v plechovce: Deep golden with an orangey sheen, hazy to cloudy, lacy white foam; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flowery to piney nose, sweet pale mal and some cookies detectable in the background; solid - but not too dry - bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied, very soft; lingering dry bitter piney finish with - as expected - hops stickin’ to the palate and still a good dash of sweet malt. Even though I’m already fed up with all the "craft-beer hop bombs", I’ve to admit that this is a well made , well balanced example of astonishing drinkability...
Poors amber, light white head. A bit of caramel. Heavy hopy, strong grapefruit, pinewood, a little of apricot. Light sweet, strong bitterness. Good balance between hope taste and bitterness.

Just an all-around very good IPA. This is one I would give to someone who has never tried an IPA before. The pine and citrus and bitter are just not that strong for someone who is not ready for it. Readily available too.
Trübes dunkles gelb schöner schaum, fruchtig citrusgrasig herber Duft, im Geschmack kräftig hopfig trockenfrüchte citrus pinie kräftig harzig herb, ein klassisches ipa das einfach schmeckt

The aroma has a nice balance between dank resin and juicy citrus. Also lots of orange peel. Two finger white head, maybe a very light off-white. Lovely colour, slightly cloudy. Initial taste is very juicy, then orange peel bitterness comes through, lingering for a very long time. It takes a good length of time for all the flavours present to make themselves apparent. The initial juicy burst makes it very drinkable, to boot. This beer has a stellar reputation; well-deserved in my book.

Aroma: lightly sweet and floral; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin white head that lingers; Taste: clean, hoppy, pleasant; Palate: medium body with medium finish; Overall: nice IPA example; would definitely get again.
12 oz. bottle. Clear pale gold, creamy white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruit. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, grapefruit notes, pine. Nice.

Drank this beer quite a lot seven years ago, I've just started again it's a classic for sure.

Hellgelb, leicht trüb mit guter Krone. Erfrischend hopfiger Antrunk, Zitrusnoten, leicht malzig, trockener Abgang!
Berlin version, just a pale replica of the original. Very bitter, not as "tasteful" as the other beers from Stone in the U.S.A.

Can, Tesco online. Just splendid hoppiness, solid malt background, not too sweet or caramelly but definitely there, long pine, grapefruit bitterness, some resin. Dry. Long finish. Great, a classic for a reason.
Aroma: fruchtig, Beeren. Bereits im Antrunk ist der gute körper zu erkennen, der durchgängig alles im griff hat. Tolö hopfiger abgang, das gefällt. Gute Säure im Nachgeschmack.

(330 ml can) Clear amber-golden beer, with a thick, fluffy white head. Gently carbonated, and can-conditioned, with a few speckles of yeast floating in the glass.

A hoppy aroma, with grapefruit, pineapple, and cantaloupe at the forefront, and a slight singe of alcohol. Spicy on the palate, but surprisingly sweet and floral, and well-balanced with a strong caramel malt. The finish is slightly more bitter, with hints of pine and mineral water.

The mouthfeel of this beer is tremendously smooth and silky - a classic West Coast IPA.

Piwo zakupione w markecie w PL , w puszce. Canned on 07MAR2017 Enjoy by 02DEC2017
Aromat: Nuty od chmielu raczej ziemiste, ziołowe, trochę przyprawowe i leciutko cytrusowe, owocowe, rozczarowujące jakością jak i intensywnością, poza tym chyba niestety lekki DMS oraz Diacetyl.
Wygląd: klarowne złote, piana średniopęcherzykowa, ale redukuje się do cienkiej warstwy.
Smak: Wytrawne, goryczka wysoka, ale nieprzyjemna ziołowo - łodygowa, zalegająca.
Odczucie w ustach: Raczej lekkie, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego.
Ogólnie: Wielkie rozczarowanie, bardzo słaba IPA.

Stone Berlin, Germany. Pours hazy golden, lot’s of yeasts in the can, big head. What surprised me a lot, that there was no smell at all. Aroma was really watery, and there was only a hint of iron. Checked with my girlfriend, she didn’t notice any aroma also, from the can and from the glass. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, a little artificial like (like some hops aroma, not like whole hops cones or granulate), also there is strong metallic flavor. Unfortunately I think that opening German brewery was not a good idea, now it’s harder to spot a real Stone beer in Europe, and this Berlin imitation of Stone IPA is just like mass production and tasteless.
The beer has got a clear deep golden-amber colour with a steady head and mediu body. Aroma of hops and pine. taste of hops, pine, citrus fruits, spruce, herbs and biscuits. Hoppy finish.
Typical West coast ipa big pine resin some peach and melon to balance. An original trailblazer.

33cl can,berlin version.Classic west coast ipa.
Aroma: pale malts, and shy hops with notes of zest and pine. Taste: moderate malty sweetness, just a touch of citrus and a big piney bitterness. Very good.

Pours a clear amber color with a medium sized, stable head.

The nose is defined by fruity hops, oranges, lemon peel and cakey malts to highlight the hops. Classical nose for an ipa, a very enjoyable though. 

Perfectly balanced, well carbonated bright and thirst quenching with a nice taste evolution regarding the evolving hop profile.

Bitter from the first glance, without pushing too far, due to balancing, sweeter malts. The hops are pretty fruity but foremost dry, bitter and in your face. Finishes soft, still dry but with a caramel malt sweetness cutting through.

Pretty wow, one the most well build west coast ipas I ve ever had. It is uncompromisingly bitter, while still caring for remaining drinkable, which is acoomplished by the noteable malts.

Clear golden with one finger white head. Dank hoppy aroma with citrus, grapefruit and tropical fruit. Taste is also dominated by dank hops accompanied by citrus, grapefruit, light pine, some tropical fruitiness and only a light and crisp malt base. Medium mouthfeel, medium carbonation and dank hoppy aftertaste.
A very good beer and I’m surprised this is the first time I’ve rated it. Well balanced, golden with an aggressive bitterness and a nice citrus flavor.
Fresh fruity aroma. Really dry with masive biterness. Very good west coast ipa!

Hazy golden. Moderate white head. Aroma: passion fruit, mango, tangerine. Medium body. Heavy bitter taste. Very fruity. Good.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

3 finger white head.
Semi-hazy, deep golden coloured beer.
Aroma is orange marmalade, honey, apricots and pungent mango. 
Taste is grapefruit and pine with a sweet and slightly ’dishcloth’-y marmalade ending. It’s that Centennial going to work. 
Medium oily mouthfeel but very crisp and refreshing. with a good bitterness bite but it could’ve used more for a full 5/5. 
Overall: Still as good as the first time I drank it and a true classic IPA. Grab a few of these, grab a few friends and barbeque the shit out of a day.

Can from Stone Brewing GmbH, Berlin. Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma of sulphur, citrus, grass, tropical fruits, lemonade, pine needles. Taste sweet with a lot of bitterness and very bitter finish.

Nice light amber pour with a thick white head that lasts. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is all bitterness...Unfortunately too much so, though. I get hints that there’s some nice flavor in there, but the bitterness covers it all up. It’s too bad, I had high hopes.
Tirador al BBF17. Cervesa daurada amb escuma blanca. Aromes herbacis amb una mica de cereal. Una mica plana però bona.
Poured a medium amber color with smooth thick head. Very nice aroma of orange/lemon zest with hints of pine. Well balance of hops and malt.
330ml can, Tesco. Pours clear amber colour. Nose is pinewood and citrus. Definite pine & grapefruit taste with the bitterness you?d expect, although not huge amounts. Some orange zest as well.
Stone Brewing knows their IPA’S. A good and juicey beer with plenty of citrus flavor and hops. Would recommend.
Kompletne india pale ale. Godne polecenia ;) Wpis w celu uzupełnienia profilu

With my local Tesco recently expanding their beer range with a bunch of american craft cans including this and the Go To IPA, I thought I’d make this classic the first entry a "why have I never reviewed this before?" series of sorts. Can - 330 ml. Pours clear amber/gold with a finger of dense white head with good retention and thick lacing. Occasional small carbonation bubble visible. Bright and fresh on the nose with Intense sweet citrus and pine resin, underneath which is a bit of cut grass, light straw and acacia honey malt. Classic west coast hop profile as expected. Taste is both subtly sweet and strongly bitter (though obviously less so than Ruination) with a lot of solid honey malt joining the grassy, resinous hop profile. Grapefruit, gooseberry, hint of mango, long, slightly dry, chalky bitter finish. Medium body, thick, silky texture, light carb; lovely mouthfeel. Exceptionally well balanced and definitely lives up to its reputation, really glad I’ve now got a ready supply of this!

Can. Poors amber, light white head. A bit of caramel. Heavy hopy, strong grapefruit, pinewood, a little of apricot. Light sweet, strong bitterness. Good balance between hope taste and bitterness. There is many IPA on market but this one is one of the best I drank during last weeks

Can 330ml (BB 12.06.2017). Clear, golden colour. White-grey, large, long lasting with good lacing head. Aroma is fresh with intense resin notes. I can say there is only a lot of pine in the aroma and that’s great. Medium to high, resin biterness but short lasting with a bit astringent finish. Light body, full hoppy, refreshing, really drinkable. I’m hoppy drinking this IPA.

1100th beer. 330ml can from Gateshead Tesco, served cold in a 1/2 pint chalice. Slightly hazy amber with a white head. I deliberately chose a "verging on iconic" beer. I don’t know if I’m right, but this feels like the original poster boy (or girl) for modern American IPA. Ripped the can lid, and smelled the Citrus, resin and tomato vine: and that’s what you taste, along with a kick of alcohol and some cereal. Also a nice toffee malt undertone. So, my favourite style scores a solid 4, it does exactly what it says on the tin and sums up the 1-1100 quite nicely. By the way, did I say I bought it at Tesco?
Ipa bastante herbal(pino), con final amargo muy seco y de durabilidad media, no esta entre mis preferencias, de complejidad media.

Can from Beer52. Golden amber with an off-white head. Tropical fruit and pine aroma. Taste of lemon, grapefruit and pine. It’s fresh and crisp and it’s a pretty decent IPA. But there’s no wow factor, and for me it doesn’t live up to its formidable reputation.
Can from Tesco. Rich golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma citrus orange and light grapefruit. Taste light fruity.

330 ml can from Tesco, London (UK). Colour is clear golden,with medium white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, pine. Taste is piney hop, orange zest, citrus, mango, other tropical fruit. Hoppy! At finishing light bitterness.

Nice can, typical Stone. A lot of information is on the webpage.
Clear golden beer with short white head, smell is very tropical fruitful and also citrus, taste is citrus, heavy bitter, medium body, short finish with bitterness, 
(I have 0.33l can with best-before 02 Oct 2017 and batch 170105060103)
Clear golden pour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour is mainly grapefruit and pine, light body, lingering bitterness. Solid.

From meny; pours bright golden with a giant white head; aroma is fruity hoppy, slightly hoppy spicy, berries, orange zest; taste is fruity hoppy, citric with some pine, fading into a solid smooth grapefruit and pine bitterness; light texture with high carbonation

33cl can at home. Appearance: slightly hazy pale straw with medium white head. Aroma: grapefruit, orange zest, hop resin, mango, pine, citrus. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of hops, grapefruit, lemon, orange and tropical fruits. Finish is bitter-dry with notes of citrus. Palate: medium bodied, watery to oily texture and lively carbonation.
Klares Orangegold mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, sehr fruchtig, Zitrusfrüchte, Orangen, Grapefruit, leicht bitter, sehr süffig.
Puszka. W aromacie kiszonka. Na drugim planie tropiki.w smaku lepiej. Fajna goryczka.

Can 0,33 l / Amstein - St-Légier (CH). Golden with an average white head for a short time, low sparkling but laces on the glass. Fruity aromas of apricot, mango, passion, lemon, citrus, malt and caramel, the whole in symbiosis. The taste is like, fruity but bitter, crispy on a nice malted backbone and caramel. The fruity nuances are complex and the bitterness of citrus, pèine and grass. Very nice, except the can.
Tasting @ fillepolo 20170310. Can from Systembolaget. Fruity, hoppy and caramely, pine needles and grapefruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, fruity and hoppy.
Beer tasting @ 10/3-17. Can from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy with grapefruit, caramel and pine needles. Body is medium, the finish is dry, hoppy and caramely with pine needles.
Overhopped and over-resinous with an unpleasant aftertaste. Really not one for me though I’m clearly in the minority!

0.33l can. Hazy yellow to golden with medium creamy white head. Aroma: caramel, mango, tangerine, yeast, malt. Taste: tangerine, juicy, resins, malty background. Medium body, moderate carbonation. High bitterness with long fruity aftertaste. Oily texture. Clean and fruity brew.

Barwa jasnego złota, piana średnia. Aromat cytrusowy, tropikalny trochę żywiczny. W smaku słodkie białe owoce, żywiczność a potem genialna grapefruitowa goryczka. Goryczka która fajnie zalega. Brak alko w smaku i fajnie grzeje w przełyk. Świetne pifko.

Can. Aroma- pleasant, but quite weak combination of resin and sweet tropical fruits. Great colour- pale and sunny. Clear, with a nice-looking, white head, which quickly falls down. Some tiny lacing. Taste- quite similar to the aroma. Again, there’re tropical fruits and forest notes, but not so clear. Medium-dry, with a subtle maltyness in the aftertaste. The bitterness is medium-high, but quite harsh and stalk-like. Medium-low-bodied, with a medium-low carbonation, which makes it very drinkable. All in all, it’s a good IPA, but for me too weak to be in the Top 50.

Aroma: Citrus and light piney aroma. But not very lasting due to the smell of alcohol cover the aroma of hops.
Appearance: clean orange with whitehead.
Taste:medium malty, sweet and bitterness, quite balanced. 

A balance of freshing and relatively high alcohol IPA.
Złocista barwa, piana niezbyt obfita. W aromacie mocno cytrusowo z owocami tropikalnymi. W smaku trochę zawód, bo w zasadzie czuć wręcz ordynarną łodygę i nic prócz tego choć da się to wypić.

This one is a hop monster. Big on the grapefruit, pine and citrus on the nose. Taste is similar, but introduces some peach, lemon, lime and mango. A good quality beer, but nothing to separate it from the crowded market of IPAs. Tried as Stone Berlin.
Duft frisk citrus lime humle smag frisk citrus lodt gran lidt bitter kant maltet
33cl can from local Alko, Viikki. Excellent IPA which sets the standard to IPA in my books. Nice hops and length with delicious tropical fruits. Brilliant!

330 ml can as Stone Berlin, served in tulip. Medium pale orange colour, slight mango smell. White head not long lasting. Blue cheese (Roquefort, Gorgonzola) and grapefruit aroma. Very bitter and salty, full-flavoured and spicy. Flat carbonated, medium body. Very bitter finish and long lasting aftertaste. Sophisticated IPA and quite interesting.

Can. Light yellow, almost clear, with big white and very solid head, good lacing. Strong citrus hoppy aroma with some grassy and herbal notes, very pleasant. Light body, dry but not watery, little bit sweet start with strong herbal bitterness. Excellent and very drinkable ipa.
citrus and light piney hop aromas. hop forward, strong citrus and piney flavors, underlying light caramel malt notes

Klasyczne IPA ze Stone’a wygląda bardzo ładnie. Jest jasne, barwa to takie bardzo jasne złoto. Klarowne. Piana jest biała, bardzo obfita, nawet dość puszysta zbudowana z małych i średnich oczek, które po kilku chwilach pękają, piana opada i pozostaje po niej gruby pierścień przy brzegach, jest też trochę śladów na ściankach. Aromat typowe dla AIPA cytrusy i trochę owoców tropikalnych. Byloby bardzo przyjemnie, gdyby nie to, że jest też wyraźny DMS, który mocno przeszkadza i psuje wrażenie. W smaku przede wszystkim wyraźna, bardzo fajna, charakterna, wysoka grejpfrutowa goryczka, nie zalegająca. Owoce cytrusowe, grejpfrut, pomarańcza, mandarynka - początek owocowy i słodki, ale natychmiast skontrowany wspomnianą goryczką, przez co generalnie piwo jest wytrawne. Ciała jest sporo, nie jest gęste, ale jest treściwe, wysycenie jest niskie. Bardzo dobry przedstawiciel stylu West Coast IPA. Wierzę, że wada w aromacie to mój niefart, że trafiłem może na gorszą warkę. Bez tego, byłoby bardzo dobrze.
